'''Renato Mannheimer''' is an [[Italy|Italian]] [[pollster]] and professor of [[sociology]] at the Universita' degli Studi di Milano - Bicocca.

He has published in academic journals<ref>http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1475-6765.1987.tb00897.x/abstract Retrieved 27 December 2010.</ref> and is a consultant to the daily Italian newspaper [[Corriere della Sera]] and to the Italian public service broadcaster [[RAI]].

He is most famous for frequently appearing on a popular RAI's talk show to provide and comment on data measuring and tracking the Italian public's attitudes concerning [[political]], [[social]], and [[economic]] issue of the day.

Up until February 2014 he chaired Rome's municipal Agency For Public Services Quality. He resigned after being indicted for tax evasion.<ref>http://www.ilfattoquotidiano.it/2014/02/25/mannheimer-indagato-dimissioni-da-presidente-autorithy-a-roma/894060/, accessed on 2 June 2015.</ref>

In February 2015 he pleaded guilty for tax evasion and returned â‚¬6m to the Italian Tax Administration.<ref>http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/cronache/renato-mannheimer-zanzara-non-guadagno-pi-nulla-vivo-solo-1096915.html, accessed on 2 June 2015.</ref> He did not serve any time in prison.

Mannheimer publicly said he was now sorry for the wrongdoing. His polling business, although less fashionable than it used to be, is still operational.
